data.name: Hard Fibonacci Challenge #1
data.description:
# Context 
This Kata series was inspired by a few other Katas on the [Fibonacci sequence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fibonacci_number):

* [Big Generalized Fibonacci numbers by dolamroth](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5d7bb3eda58b36000fcc0bbb)
* [The Millionth Fibonacci Kata by xcthulhu](https://www.codewars.com/kata/the-millionth-fibonacci-kata)

# Definition
The generalization of the original Fibonacci sequence `$F(n)$` to `$F_{a,b}(n)$` is defined by `$F_{a,b}(n) := a.(F_{a,b}(n-2))+b.(F_{a,b}(n-1)),\;F_{a,b}(0)=0,\;F_{a,b}(1)=1$`. You have to return the `n-th` value of the generalized Fibonacci sequence.

# Extra challenge
* Code length limited to 1000 characters
* Extreme performance test

# Constraints
* `$0\leq n\leq10^5,\;(a,b) = (2,2)$`
* `$0\leq n\leq10^6,\;(a,b) \in \{(1,1),\;(1,2),\;(2,1)\}$`
* `$0\leq n\leq10^9,\;(a,b) \in \{(0,1),\;(1,0),\;(0,0)\}$`

### Good luck!
